Huawei is a leading global information and communications technology (ICT) solutions provider. Driven by a commitment to sound operations, ongoing innovation, and open collaboration, we have established a competitive ICT portfolio of end-to-end solutions in telecom and enterprise networks, devices, and cloud technology and services. Our ICT solutions, products, and services are used in more than 170 countries and regions, serving over one-third of the world's population. With 180,000 employees, Huawei is committed to enabling the future information society, and building a Better Connected World.

The size of our cloud platform is gaining momentum and it is already planet scale. Huawei Cloud is one of the largest and fastest-growing platforms in the world. It has strong presence with over 40 availability zones located across 4 continents and 23 geographical regions, covering locations such as Germany, Hong Kong, South Africa, or Brazil, among others.

Huawei's Munich Research Center is responsible for advanced technology research, architectural development, design and strategic engineering of our products.

Our team’s mission is to develop new intelligent tools aimed at SRE and cloud maintenance operators to enable them to quickly detect anomalies thanks to the use of artificial intelligence when cloud services are slow or unresponsive. We analyze observability data from Huawei Cloud to detect glitches which impact customers, identify their root cause within seconds, and automatically fix problems, when possible.

To drive reliability, we are seeking for a Machine Learning Engineer/Researcher to join the Ultra-scale AIOps Lab which is distributed across Munich, Dublin, and Shenzhen Research Centers. This team is entrusted with developing key data mining and machine learning algorithms for Huawei Cloud. You will take systematic approaches to solve operation problems, dissect how large-scale, complicated systems work, and feel a great satisfaction from making continuous improvements.

Responsibilities
Use deep learning and machine learning to create scalable solutions for business problems.
Develop new tools using cutting edge technology focusing on efficiency and automation.
Work closely with the AIOps team to jointly develop innovative tools driven by AI.
Build ML systems in production settings.
Collaborate with colleagues from science, engineering, and business backgrounds.
Requirements
Experience with statistical software (e.g., Pandas, R) and programming languages (e.g., Python, Java).
Hands-on expertise with ML libraries (e.g., Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, Keras).
Experience with applying machine learning on large-scale datasets.
Experience with fast prototyping.
Demonstrated ability to solve challenging engineering problems is required.
Fluent written and spoken English.
PhD in Computer Science or related field
What you can expect
Meaningful work: Our products and solutions connect people in over 170 countries, serving more than one third of the world’s population.
Enormous investments in research, development and innovation: Huawei invests over 10% of its revenues in research and development, which enhances our competitiveness while driving industry and technology.
Team spirit: At Huawei, we are proud of a strong social integration. Doors are open, and people collaborate with each other in a constructive and solution oriented manner.
International work environment: Our business language is English and our team comprises unique experts from around 50 different countries.
Robust growth across all business segments, thanks to balanced global presence and strategic focus.
If you are enthusiastic about tackling real-world problems which require engineering and theoretical approaches to be solved, and you love to work with a dynamic group of people driven by challenges, come and join us!

Job Title: Drug Safety Data Scientist (all genders) - Datenbankentwicklung / BI, IT
Job Description:
Stellennummer 205310

A career at our company is an ongoing journey of discovery: our around 56,000 people are shaping how the world lives, works and plays through next generation advancements in healthcare, life science and performance materials. For more than 350 years and across the world we have passionately pursued our curiosity to find novel and vibrant ways of enhancing the lives of others.

Your Role:


The Safety Data Retrieval Team provides outputs of the safety database to various customers within Global Patient Safety. You will act as an interface between our customers (physicians and operational units) and IT team members. Hence, you understand the medical and scientific questions of our teams and translate them into technical requirements for database search strategies. You can understand and improve complex SQL statements and deliver measurable improvements by automating and optimizing existing operations and tools. You will develop innovative methods to analyze, evaluate, and present pharmacovigilance data. You will support the query operations by creating and quality checking database outputs. You will support the signal management process by managing the Oracle Empirica cloud application.
If you are a curious mind with combined expertise in data science and biological sciences, you are a great candidate for us.

Who you are:
Master’s Degree in Bioinformatics, Biostatistics, Data Sciences or Computer Science
Expert in programming languages (SQL/PLSQL, Visual Basic for Applications, Python, R, or similar)
Excellent Microsoft Office knowledge
Solid understanding of reporting and visualization software (IBM Cognos Analytics, Spotfire or similar)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong written and oral communication skills
Experience with pharmacovigilance databases (ARISg, Argus Safety) is a plus
Experience with the signal management system Oracle Empirica is a plus
Fluent spoken and written English, good language skills in German is a plus
What we offer: With us, there are always opportunities to break new ground. We empower you to fulfil your ambitions, and our diverse businesses offer various career moves to seek new horizons. We trust you with responsibility early on and support you to draw your own career map that is responsive to your aspirations and priorities in life. Join us and bring your curiosity to life!

Curious? Apply and find more information at https://jobs.vibrantm.com

Die Deutsche Bahn ist einer der vielfältigsten Arbeitgeber Deutschlands. Wir suchen Jahr für Jahr begeisterte Mitarbeiter für mehr als 500 verschiedene Berufe, die gemeinsam mit uns Menschen und Märkte bewegen.

DB Analytics ist der Spezialist für statistische und mathematische Methoden innerhalb der Deutschen Bahn AG. In einem interdisziplinären Team entwickeln wir agil Verfahren in den Bereichen Big Data-Analytics, mathematische Optimierung und Simulation. Diese Verfahren setzen wir in allen Geschäftsfeldern des Unternehmens ein, um Planungs- und Betriebsprozesse effizienter zu gestalten und das Angebot besser auf die Bedürfnisse der Bahnkunden abzustimmen.

Wenn es Dich reizt, die Netzwerke und den Ressourceneinsatz der Bahn so zu optimieren, dass ein Mehrwert für Kunden und Unternehmen entsteht, dann werde Mitglied unseres innovativen Teams und stärke unsere Kompetenz im Bereich Data Science.

www.deutschebahn.com/db-analytics

Zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt suchen wir Dich für den Bereich DB Analytics in Frankfurt am Main.
Deine Aufgaben:
Du entwickelst neue Analyse-/ und Prognoseideen auf der Basis Deiner Methodenkenntnis und Deiner Einsicht in die Herausforderungen der Deutschen Bahn
Analyse-/ und Prognoseziele spezifizierst Du in Abstimmung mit den internen Kunden
Die Beschaffung, Integration und Aufbereitung der erforderlichen Datengrundlagen gehört ebenso zu Deinen Aufgaben
Du führst Analysen und Prognosen z.B. auf der Basis von Markt-/ und Nachfragedaten, Betriebsdaten oder Anlagendaten mit dem Ziel, Muster und Zusammenhänge zu erkennen und belastbare Vorhersagen zu generieren, durch
Ebenso entwickelst Du Analyse-/ und Prognose-Verfahren (realtime oder offline), die in die IT-Landschaft des Kunden integriert werden können
Du steuerst Projekte von der Scoping-Phase bis zur Installation und Wartung der Analyse-/ und Prognose-Verfahren beim Kunden
Dein Profil:
Du hast einen exzellenten Abschluss in Mathematik, Statistik, Physik, Informatik, Volks-/ oder Betriebswirtschaft, oder eines verwandten Studiengangs mit quantitativem Schwerpunkt
Mehrjährige praktische Erfahrung im Bereich multivariate Daten-Analyse, maschinelles Lernen und Daten-Management, gerne auch im Rahmen einer Promotion, bringst Du ebenso mit
Deine Kenntnisse in R, Python und SQL sind ausgeprägt, weitergehende Programmierkenntnisse sind wünschenswert
Du kennst Dich aus im Umgang mit Datenbanken und im Hadoop-Ökosystem
Dich kennzeichnen ausgeprägte analytische Fähigkeiten in Verbindung mit konzeptioneller Gestaltungskraft
Eine intrinsische Motivation mit rastlosem Innovationsgeist und starker Teamorientierung zeichnen Dich aus
Du hast eine ausgeprägte Kommunikationsfähigkeit
Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift runden Dein Profil ab

Benefits:
Du schaffst Großes und bekommst nicht weniger zurück: ein marktübliches Gehaltspaket mit i.d.R. unbefristeten Arbeitsverträgen und Beschäftigungssicherung sowie vielfältige Nebenleistungen und eine betriebliche Altersvorsorge.
Faszinierende Projekte und Aufgaben von der Digitalisierung eines Großkonzerns bis zum Projekt Zukunft Bahn fordern Dein Können und warten auf Deine Handschrift.
Gezielte und individuelle Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten auf Fach-, Projekt- oder Führungsebene geben Dir eine langfristige Perspektive.

Chancengleichheit und selbstbestimmte Teilhabe Schwerbehinderter und Gleichgestellter sowie eine respektvolle Zusammenarbeit sind innerhalb des DB Konzerns fest verankerte Grundsätze. Deshalb werden schwerbehinderte Bewerber bei gleicher Eignung bevorzugt berücksichtigt.
Competitors: Lufthansa Group, Deutsche Post & DHL, Daimler

Job Title: (Senior) Data Scientist - Groceries and New Verticals (f/m/d)
Job Description:
Want to be a hero? - Join the #1 Global Leader in online food ordering and delivery!

We are looking for a (Senior) Data Scientist (f/m/d) to join our Data Insights team. This opportunity sits within a newly formed team, taking care of all data needs for Delivery Hero’s new verticals.

From the first day you will take responsibility and contribute to the creation of our next generation platform, that works on expanding our amazing delivery to new products as groceries, pharmaceuticals, flowers and more. Work on warehouse management systems, our shopper app and our customer facing systems.

If you’re a creative problem solver who is hungry for a new adventure, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!

Your mission:
Identify business needs and collect requirements for new data products

Conduct descriptive and inferential statistical analyses, hypothesis testing and real life experiments

Develop new scalable data products from conception to operationalization

Help defining data needs to further improve existing projects, to support data engineering and tech teams in planning their roadmap

Work with structured and unstructured data from different data sources (e.g. BigQuery, PostgreSQL and many more)

Contribute and make an impact in a global, fast-moving tech organization.

What you bring to the table:
Advanced experience (4+ years) designing and developing artificial intelligence or machine learning applications at scale.

Strong academic knowledge and strong hands on experience (4+ years) in data mining, applied statistics and machine learning

Good knowledge (3+ years) of SQL

Proficiency (2+ years) with Python for data science applications

Familiar with languages and tools for data manipulation, analysis and plotting (R, R-shiny, R-markdown, Scikit, Numpy/Scipy, Pandas, Matplotlib, Bokeh, Jupyter)

Familiar with mathematical and statistical data analysis techniques (such as regression, extrapolation, time series analysis, forecasting, statistical hypothesis testing and econometric models)

Technically confident, independent and able to communicate clearly and concisely

Proactively seeks to improve the performance and quality of built solution

Hands on and pragmatic approach to new challenges

Able to work independently and seek additional knowledge among their peers

Rigorous, detail-oriented, and attentive to the correctness of the solutions

Adopts and pushes for improving team standards

Why Delivery Hero?

Develop your skills with your educational budget for conferences and external trainings.

Exchange ideas and meet fellow developers at regular meetups, in our active guilds and during our Global Developer Exchange Program.

Join company parties, hackathons, cultural and sports events.

Work in diverse teams with colleagues from across the globe in English.

Save responsibly with our corporate pension scheme.

Daily fruits, cereals, beverages, tea and coffee in our lounges.

Learn German with free classes, access our e-learning platform and participate in our inhouse trainings.

Enjoy massages, get your haircut in the office, join our free yoga classes or take a timeout in our nap room.

About us:
Delivery Hero is building the next generation global on-demand delivery platform. We have grown rapidly from inception in 2011 to become the world's largest food-ordering network and we’re now innovating and creating new verticals such as groceries, pharmacies, flowers and other convenience articles in multiple markets.

Our awesome international team already operates in 40+ countries worldwide and we are looking for the most talented people to join us on our mission to ‘always deliver an amazing experience.’ If you’re an enthusiastic problem solver and hungry for a new adventure, an exciting job and multicultural workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!

At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and representation is key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or any other aspect that makes you, you.

Have we caught your attention? If you are looking for an environment where our company DNA is defined by our values, please send us your CV.

Find out more information on how to prepare for you technical interview here.

We’re looking forward to your application!

AUFGABEN

Unsere Einheit IR Sensing entwickelt, produziert und verkauft NIR Spektrometer Lösungen unter dem Namen trinamiX NIR Spectroscopy Solutions. Gemeinsam mit unseren Kunden entwickeln wir Lösungen für unterschiedliche Anwendungsbereiche wie Landwirtschaft, Lebensmittelanalyse und Spektroskopie bis hin zur Funkendetektion und Branderkennung.

Dafür übernehmen Sie die wissenschaftliche Datenanalyse, Evaluation statistischer Hypothesen und datenbasierte Modellbildung.
Des Weiteren sind Sie verantwortlich für die Optimierung, Design of Experiments und Six-Sigma Methodik sowie Visualisierung.
Sie entwickeln robuste Systeme zur chemometrischen Beurteilung von Stoffdaten aus spektroskopischen Messungen.
Dabei arbeiten Sie in einem multidisziplinären Forschungsteam.
Mit den entsprechenden Experten integrieren Sie die Modelle in einen größeren Software-Stack.

QUALIFIKATIONEN

Hochschulabschluss auf dem Gebiet der angewandten Mathematik, Statistik, Chemometrie, Informatik oder eng verwandten Bereichen, mit Promotion oder entsprechender Berufserfahrung
Als Quereinsteiger einen naturwissenschaftlichen oder ingenieurtechnischen Hintergrund
Idealerweise Berufserfahrung in Datenanalyse, Datenmodellierung, gezielter Datensuche und statistischer Analyse
Darüber hinaus sind Kenntnisse im Machine Learning sowie nichtlineare Optimierung vorteilhaft
Ausgeprägte Erfahrung mit R, SAS, Python oder anderen Programmiersprachen im Fast Prototyping
Motivierter und kreativer Teamplayer mit ausgeprägten Kommunikations- und Präsentationsfähigkeiten in Deutsch sowie Englisch
Freude an Mitarbeit in einem interdisziplinären Forschungs- und Entwicklungsteam

BENEFITS

Attraktives Gehalt, das sich am Geschäftserfolg und Ihrer individuellen Leistung orientiert.
Mobiles Arbeiten, damit Sie Ihren Arbeitsalltag und Ihr Privatleben flexibler gestalten und besser vereinen können.

ÜBER UNS

Sie haben Fragen zum Bewerbungsprozess oder der Stelle? Herr Fidan Bllacaku (Talent Acquisition), Tel.: +49 (0)30 2005 59400

Die trinamiX GmbH mit Sitz in Ludwigshafen wurde 2015 gegründet und ist eine 100-prozentige Tochter der BASF SE. Als Start-up sind wir operativ eigenständig und können zugleich auf die Kompetenzen und Erfahrungen der BASF-Gruppe zurückgreifen. Was uns antreibt? Unsere Technologien sollen es Mensch und Maschine ermöglichen, die Welt zu erfassen und zu verstehen - für eine bessere Entscheidungsfindung und mehr Sicherheit. Dafür arbeiten wir in den Bereichen 3D-Sensorik, Distanzmessung und Infrarot-Sensorik. Für unser Team suchen wir keine Nachfolger und keinen Ersatz. Wir suchen Pioniere!
Mehr über die trinamiX GmbH erfahren Sie unter www.trinamix.de

Bei BASF stimmt die Chemie. Denn wir setzen auf Innovation in unseren Lösungen, auf Nachhaltigkeit in unserem Handeln und auf Verbundenheit in unserem Denken. Und auf Sie. Werden Sie Teil unserer Erfolgsformel und entwickeln Sie mit uns die Zukunft - in einem globalen Team, das Vielfalt lebt und sich für Chancengerechtigkeit unabhängig von Alter, Herkunft, Geschlecht, sexueller Identität, Behinderung oder Weltanschauung einsetzt.

As a part of Strategic Growth Businesses (SGB) of Amadeus, Travel Audience unit is the world’s leading data-driven travel advertising platform. The business unit harnesses the power of cutting edge machine learning practices to connect the leading performance-oriented advertisers with the biggest network of publishers, reaching millions of travellers. The strategy is to optimize advertising across the entire traveller journey, identify and create new audiences, and increase our partners reach, relevance and booking volumes.

Travel Audience is looking for a Senior Data Scientist to join our Data Tribe. You'll report to the Data Science Manager and be part of our talented Data tribe composed by Data Analyst, Data Engineers, Data Scientists and Business Analysts.

What you will do:
Responsible for the full development cycle of models from data collection, cleaning and feature engineering to prototyping and model selection to experimental evaluation to documentation and maintenance
Build statistical and machine learning models to identify online users who are likely to purchase travel products
Research and design advanced bidding and budget allocation strategies to improve the performance of our in-house bidder
Collaborate with data engineers to develop and improve our scalable streaming user profiling platform
Enjoy huge data volumes and fast feedback loops via our real-time system

Why join us?

As part of our team, you will work in a highly motivated environment, with equal opportunities, flat hierarchies and short decision-making processes. You’ll have a lot of freedom to contribute your own ideas and implement them.

The opportunity to drive business growth and truly having an impact on the business
A fast-paced industry where you handle new problems every day
An environment where you are encouraged to research, explore and try new ways of doing things
An open and dynamic culture that supports great work-life balance, while being part of Amadeus, the biggest travel tech company in the world

About you:
You have strong statistics and data wrangling skills: experimental design, data transformation, machine learning, validation and evaluation
You have excellent interpersonal communication skills and are comfortable giving presentations
You care about the quality and correctness of your work
You are curious and like to communicate based on data and insights
You are able to think about the context and business impact of the problems you're solving
You are results-oriented and have a record of successfully delivering projects
You possess good programming skills (preferably Python), have experience working with machine learning frameworks and writing SQL queries, and are able to learn new technologies quickly

For any queries, you can reach out to Gizem Turan at talent@travelaudience.com

We are awaiting your application and looking forward to starting our journey together!

Meet Ziyad, one of our Data Engineers

Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams suchen wir eine/einen:
Business Intelligence / Data Analyst (m/w)

Job Title: Simulation and Machine Learning Research Scientist (f/m/x)
Job Description:
Oberkochen or Jena
Thrive on innovation at a global technology leader. Develop exciting solutions in a diverse, stable work environment that’s focused on the future. Join us in a modern work environment with an open and inspiring culture and colleagues!
You want to pioneer?
In current machine learning applications the physical basis of optical imaging is hardly taken into account and one is often limited by the amount of available training data. In current optical development processes machine learning based methods play only a minor role. Your role is to change that. Integrated in a team you will advance ideas from academic stages to industrial product development. This comprises conceptional work and taking the initiative as well as implementing virtual prototypes and evaluating their performance. During your work you will build an excellent network with us in both academia and industry that will help us to leverage the latest technology advancements in order to address tomorrow's challenges.
You have
a strong theoretical background with a PhD in Mathematics, Physics, Computer Science or similar
a deep understanding of physical optics and machine learning as well as the ability to quickly grasp and discuss ideas in these areas
practical state-of-the-art knowledge on neural networks, synthetic data generation, and machine learning based simulation techniques
excellent programming skills in Python, Matlab, or C++ and you are familiar with toolkits such as OpenGL and Tensorflow
preferably parallelization skills (CUDA, OpenCL, OpenMP)
an innovative and decidedly hands-on mindset: you love to work on hard problems
At ZEISS we encourage creative thinking and innovation. We work in dynamic and interdisciplinary teams and offer individual development perspectives as well as flexibility in organizing your work. We care about our employees and take particular responsibility for improving society and preserving our environment. These core values have shaped our corporate culture at ZEISS for over 170 years.

Join us and shape the future!
The application process takes less than 10 minutes, we look forward to receiving your application.

Standort: Darmstadt

IHRE AUFGABEN
Sie sind mitverantwortlich für die Betreuung und konzeptionelle Weiterentwicklung und Wartung der bestehenden MIS-Applikationen und des Berichtswesens sowie für den Ausbau von Kennzahlensystemen
Sie sorgen für reibungslose Datenflüsse aus Vorsystemen und die Validierung dieser Daten
Sie führen betriebswirtschaftliche Analysen durch und unterstützen bei der Forecast- und Budgeterstellung
Sie unterstützen die Business-Intelligence-Anwender mit Best Practices und führen Schulungen dazu durch
IHR PROFIL
Sie haben ein Bachelor- oder Masterstudium erfolgreich abgeschlossen (BWL, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Mathematik etc.) oder verfügen über eine vergleichbare Ausbildung
Fundierte Kenntnisse in BI-Anwendungen setzen wir ebenso voraus wie den sicheren Umgang mit den Microsoft-Office-Tools; darüber hinaus sind Kenntnisse in Transact-SQL und Excel VBA von Vorteil
Sollten Sie bereits Erfahrungen mit Infor BI haben, wäre das Ideal.
Fähigkeit, komplexe Management-Strukturen aufzubereiten und zu analysieren
Selbstständige und analytische Arbeitsweise, hohe Team- und Kommunikationsfähigkeit sowie ausgeprägtes Qualitätsbewusstsein
Sehr gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
INTERESSIERT?

Bitte bewerben Sie sich ausschließlich online. Ihre Bewerbung sollte ein kurzes Anschreiben, einen tabellarischen Lebenslauf sowie Ihre Ausbildungs- und Arbeitszeugnisse enthalten.

Ihr Kontakt:

Yvonne Exeler, Manager HR Recruiting & Onboarding DACH, Tel.: +49 (0) 681 210 - 3727, E-Mail: yvonne.exeler@softwareag.com

Job Title: Junior Data Scientist (f/m/d) Center of Excellence for the Intelligent ERP (SAP Labs Munich)
Job Description:
Requisition ID: 253113
Work Area: Software-Design and Development
Location: Hallbergmoos
Expected Travel: 0 - 10%
Career Status: Graduate
Employment Type: Regular Full Time

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

SAP started in 1972 as a team of five colleagues with a desire to do something new. Together, they changed enterprise software and reinvented how business was done. Today, as a market leader in enterprise application software, we remain true to our roots. That’s why we engineer solutions to fuel innovation, foster equality and spread opportunity for our employees and customers across borders and cultures.

SAP values the entrepreneurial spirit, fostering creativity and building lasting relationships with our employees. We know that a diverse and inclusive workforce keeps us competitive and provides opportunities for all. We believe that together we can transform industries, grow economics, lift up societies and sustain our environment. Because it’s the best-run businesses that make the world run better and improve people’s lives.

About the team

The intelligent processes organization will make SAP S/4HANA the first AI-enabled ERP solution in the market leveraging AI technologies. It brings together development and customers in a Co-innovation Engagement.

You will join the newly founded intelligent ERP Center of Excellence, consisting of developers, architects, and data scientists, produces tangible prototypes and concepts for these high-priority inquiries.

Join us in helping our customers to reimagine their business and create new possibilities that allow them to dream bigger, work smarter and change their worlds.

The Role

Being a strong member of a technology savvy, agile and innovative team, you will be responsible for evaluating cutting-edge AI topics and AI trends against future enterprise business use cases. Furthermore, you will be implementing next generation machine learning prototypes for our customers.

As a data scientist in these co-innovation engagements, you will help some of the largest enterprises in the world to take their processes to the next level - be it in data-driven business insights, intelligent automation or great user experience of an adaptive business software. This is an ideal role for a focused and ambitious individual who can work in a highly flexible environment.

Role Requirements
Degree in data science, mathematics, statistics, computer science or another related field, holding a PhD is a plus
In-depth knowledge of data mining and machine learning concepts to create valuable insights from structured and unstructured data
Programming skills in Python, using state-of-the-art ML libraries
Fluent German and English in speaking and writing is mandatory.
Moreover, the ideal candidate for this position is an open-minded, curious person and continuous learner with strong team working skills.

Work Experience
Proven track record of data science projects
Graduates are welcome to apply!
WHAT YOU GET FROM US

Success is what you make it. At SAP, we help you make it your own.

A career at SAP can open many doors for you. If you’re searching for a company that’s dedicated to your ideas and individual growth, recognizes you for your unique contributions, fills you with a strong sense of purpose, and provides a fun, flexible and inclusive work environment – apply now.

SAP'S DIVERSITY COMMITMENT
To harness the power of innovation, SAP invests in the development of its diverse employees. We aspire to leverage the qualities and appreciate the unique competencies that each person brings to the company.

SAP is committed to the principles of Equal Employment Opportunity and to providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team (Americas: Careers.NorthAmerica@sap.com or Careers.LatinAmerica@sap.com, APJ: Careers.APJ@sap.com, EMEA: Careers@sap.com).

Successful candidates might be required to undergo a background verification with an external vendor.

Additional Locations:

Deine Aufgabe

ist die Unterstützung der Entwicklungsabteilung bei der Entwicklung von innovativen Algorithmen durch systematische Datenanalyse.

Das bringst Du mit:
Studium in einem natur- oder ingenieurwissenschaftlichen Fachbereich wie z.B. Physik, Elektrotechnik oder Informatik
Gute Kenntnisse im Umgang mit Python und Pandas
SQL-Kenntnisse wären wünschenswert
Gute analytische, strukturierte und konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten
Gute Team- und Kommunikationsfähigkeiten sowie selbstständiges Arbeiten
Gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift
Wir bieten Dir

eine anspruchsvolle, interessante und abwechslungsreiche Aufgabe in einem dynamischen und innovativen Umfeld sowie ein motiviertes Team innerhalb einer gemeinschaftlich gestalteten Unternehmenskultur. Flexible Arbeitszeiten und kurze Entscheidungswege ermöglichen eigenverantwortliches Arbeiten und viel Gestaltungsspielraum.

Ansprechpartner

Im Rahmen dessen suchen wir ab sofort in Voll- und Teilzeit einen

Data Engineer (w/m/d)

Deine Aufgaben:
Kompetente technische und fachliche Beratung unserer Kunden im nationalen und internationalen Umfeld rund um das Thema Data Warehousing, Data Lakes und Data Management
Auswahl und Nutzung geeigneter Technologien und Produkte für die Verarbeitung von Datenströmen in der Cloud und on-premise
Verantwortung für die Definition von Standards und Richtlinien für die Entwicklung effizienter Data Management & Data Engineering Verarbeitungen
Funktion als Coach für unsere Kunden und das Projektteam bezüglich Daten Engineering und Data Management Fragestellungen
(Teil-)Projektleitung mit Verantwortung für Consulting, Konzeption und Umsetzung in Projekten mit unternehmensstrategischer Ausrichtung
Etablieren von DevOps Pipelines & Automatisierung
aktive Unterstützung bei der Weiterentwicklung unserer Data Engineering Konzepte zu Enterprise Data Warehousing, Data Lakes, Big Data Lösungen und Analytics Plattformen
Unterstützung des Vertriebs in Angebotsprozessen und in der Neukundengewinnung

Persönlich zeichnest du dich aus durch:
Abgeschlossenes Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik oder anderes vergleichbares Studium
Mehrjährige Projekterfahrung im Aufbau von Datenbewirtschaftungslösungen (ETL, ELT, Streaming…)
Mitarbeit in agilen Projekten, Nutzung von DevOps Konzepten
Projekterfahrung mit einer oder mehreren der folgenden Technologien: Kafka, Spark, Oracle PL/SQL, Informatica, Data Warehouse Automation
Projekterfahrung in der Nutzung von Cloud Technologien für das Data Management sowie Erfahrung in der Datenmodellierung (Data Vault, Dimensional, 3NF, ADAPT etc.)
souveränes Auftreten, schnelle Auffassungsgabe, strukturierte, methodische Vorgehensweise, ausgeprägte konzeptionelle Fähigkeiten und die Fähigkeit zur adäquaten Vermittlung komplexer Sachverhalte
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse

Wir bieten dir:
Interessante und spannende Projekte in einem agilen Unternehmen
Ein interdisziplinär aufgestelltes Team, in dem auch der Spaß an der Arbeit nicht zu kurz kommt
Vertrauensarbeitszeit, Home-Office Möglichkeiten und attraktive Sozialleistungen
Sportgruppen, Firmenevents und jede Menge Gesundheitsinitiativen
Ein innovatives Umfeld, berufliche Weiterentwicklung und Weiterbildungsprogramme
Stylische Büroräume im Herzen Münchens sowie moderne Ausstattung

Weitere Benefits

Für Fragen steht Dir Silke Kügel unter 089/360 531-51 81 gerne zur Verfügung.

Job Title: Werkstudententätigkeit / Praktikum Data Science und künstliche Intelligenz
Job Description:
Werkstudententätigkeit / Praktikum Data Science und künstliche Intelligenz

Deine Aufgaben
Du entwickelst Machine Learning- und Deep Learning-Verfahren zur Erzeugung von strukturierten Daten aus unstrukturiertem Text.
Für eine prototypische Implementierung verwendest du weltweit etablierte Machine-Learning-Frameworks, wie z.B. TensorFlow und Keras.
Bei der Erweiterung der SmartSearch in unserer SmartWe App unterstützt du uns.
Du hilfst uns bei der prototypischen Anbindung externer Datenquellen (z.B. Open Data, Identitätsprovider etc.).

Deine Skills
Machine Learning und das Entwickeln von Prototypen mit künstlicher Intelligenz ist genau dein Ding.
Dein Studium machst du in einem informatikorientierten Studiengang (Bachelor oder Master).
Du hast gute Kenntnisse in objektorientierten Technologien (u.a. Java), die du schon in der Praxis testen konntest.
Problemlösungskompetenz und analytisches Denkvermögen zeichnen dich aus.

Working together to develop future-proof solutions for tomorrow’s business world: that’s our goal, along with our 10,000 colleagues across 20 locations throughout Germany. Thanks to our innovative services in auditing, tax consulting as well as transaction and management consulting, we proudly lead our clients into the future. With our Assurance Services, we strengthen public confidence in global capital markets and promote sustainable growth. If you’re looking to develop your individual skills whilst working in interdisciplinary and multicultural teams, come join us!

What you can expect - enriching experiences that will last a lifetime

In our Assurance Digital Center in Hamburg, Frankfurt/Main, Munich or Stuttgart, you are responsible for developing new business models and digital audit methods together with our clients. Innovative technologies and quantitative procedures allow you to quickly find better answers to business-related questions in the auditing sector. Here, you will take on various tasks:
Meeting with prospective clients to understand their business problems
Creatively and innovatively extracting data from various client systems (e.g. SAP, Oracle, JD Edwards)
Actively contribute to building knowledge capital through experience and research
Leading teams and reviewing work packages of junior professionals
Coaching team members to reach their potential
What you can contribute - skills for shaping the future
At least 5 years of work experience in a similar field
Data analysis skills with strengths in drilling into underlying databases for discovery and identifying opportunities and trends and translating these into business outputs
Experience in data analysis and manipulation with any of the following software: SQL Server, SAS, IBM SPSS, Hadoop
Experience in utilizing and deploying ETL software (e.g. SSIS, CloverETL, Talend, SAP Data Services)
Excellent relational SQL database skills (Open SQL, PL-SQL or T-SQL)
Demonstrate understanding in at least one programming language such as R, Python, Java, C++ or C#
Experience using data visualization tools such as, Spotfire, Tableau, Qlik, Power BI
Be a team leader with excellent communication and relationship building skills in order to work across both technical and business teams "
What we are offering - an inspiring work environment
Diversity and an open corporate culture
Fantastic career opportunities thanks to individual support, challenging project work and a strong EY network
Diverse and interesting work opportunities thanks to our innovative activities with a varied and exciting client list
Find out more here about the many benefits to which you are entitled as employee at EY.

Become part of our high-performing teams!
Apply online via our job portal www.de.ey.com
If you have any questions, please contact our Recruitment Center at +49 6196 996 10005.

Is there a logistics for careers? There is with us! As a globally operating logistics service provider with 33,000 employees in over 50 countries, we manage complex supply chains and offer our customers innovative value-added services. Rhenus Office Systems provides its customers with comprehensive support in implementing their digital strategy for both physical and digital information. The range of services also includes customer management, cloud, and BPO solutions.

Machine Learning Engineer (f/m/d) place Berlin timelapse Vollzeit access_time Ab sofort

In the times of a pandemic it is important for a country to have a strong and efficient healthcare system. In Germany, Medical Information Analytics supports hospitals to remain sustainable and optimize their invoices. You work in a modern corporate start-up, driven by an international team of professional, enthusiastic people and modern technology. In order to up our game we want to extend both aspects.

What you can expect
You evolve our machine learning driven data analysis.
Moreover you improve the existing models.
Design and implementation of new models and solutions is one of your tasks.
You educate your colleagues on the practical aspects of ML model development.
Finally you dive into the data in search for more use cases.
What you bring
You have experience in the application of machine learning models (1-2 years), favourably in the area of NLP and classification.
Solid understanding of rule-based systems is required.
You have good development skills in either python, scala and/or java with respect to implementation of ML models.
Furthermore you are an enthusiastic person who can educate others.
Personally you score with a team player attitude.
Finally a proficient English or German language background is necessary.

Flat hierarchies
Flexible working times
Free drinks
Fruit basket
Great Team
Individual development

At 12traits we believe the path to a better future lies in unlocking the true potential of humankind. We do this through harmonizing human behavior data with psychological trait sets, leveraging a multitude of scientifically valid data perspectives that allow us to understand human beings more deeply and sustainably than ever before: ushering in a new era of personalized experiences, starting in gaming, optimized for human potential and health.

Elevating the human experience is at the core of everything we do. That core is realized through our human-facing machine learning algorithms, our unparalleled understanding of a user within any given environment, and our ability to personalize experiences in real time.

As a data scientist, you’ll work closely with psychometricians, engineers, as well as UX designers and researchers to actualize the potential derived from combining some of the richest behavioral data sets available with cognitive data. You'll not only get to push your own boundaries, but the boundaries of artificial intelligence.


WHAT YOU WILL OWN AND DRIVE
Perform complex statistical analyses on large data sets of unique psychometric data
Refine our base algorithm that translates psychometric data into actionable insights for our customers
Leverage large quantities and diverse sets of behavioral data to drive our proprietary machine learning algorithm
Incorporate the latest findings from machine learning and psychological research into a working product
Support our research and development roadmap to advance our machine learning algorithm at the core of our (future) products


WHAT YOU NEED TO BRING TO THE TABLE
MS in Computer Science, Physics, Computational Neuroscience, or related field
4+ years of highly relevant practical experience in data science or data engineering
Demonstrated experience with a wide variety of machine learning models and techniques (e.g. supervised and unsupervised learning, dimensionality reduction)
Exceptional command of Python and relevant libraries (Numpy, Scipy, Sklearn, etc.)
A strong understanding of the fundamental mechanics of machine learning algorithms
A portfolio of activities / a side project that showcases your intellectual curiosity


WHAT MAKES YOU STAND OUT
A PhD in Computer Science, Physics, Computational Neuroscience, or related field
Familiarity with modern infrastructure and tools (e.g. Kubernetes, Docker, AWS) and large-scale data processing technologies (e.g. SQL, Hadoop, Spark)
Knowledge of modern deep learning frameworks and libraries (Tensorflow, PyTorch, Theano, etc.)
Hands-on experience with behavioral and event data from video games (mainly mobile and PC) including prediction models (e.g. churn, monetization, LTV)
Familiarity with and interest in psychometric data
Experience in a fast-paced, startup environment


HOW WE WILL SUPPORT YOU:
The opportunity to shape a ground-breaking and important idea from the early days
A high level of ambition combined with a clear vision
Highly motivated and experienced team with the relevant domain expertise and networks
A competitive compensation package with a significant equity share
Support for training and personal development
The opportunity to work in an international team in the US and Europe

Job Title: Computer scientist (f/m/d) - B.A or equivalent education
Job Description:
The German Center for Neurodegenerative Diseases (DZNE) is a unique non-university research center which is dedicated to the subject dementia and all its areas, as well as other neurodegenerative diseases. The center compasses the full spectrum of fundamental research through population sciences to health care research. The DZNE stands for excellence in research and science management, translation of scientific results into practice, interdisciplinarity and internationalization. It is a research center within the Helmholtz Organization of German research centers. With over 1000 employees from 55 nations, spread over 10 sites, the DZNE is one of the national and international leading research centers in its research field.

Computer scientist (f/m/d) - B.A or equivalent education
Code: 1784/2020/3

to support our technology platforms in the area of image and data analysis.

You are confident on the Linux command line; you like to solve tricky technical

problems and you want to be part of an international team of

scientists and data scientists working on the development of new therapies

for Alzheimer's disease and other diseases?

Then we are looking for you. Many challenging tasks await you!

Your tasks
Development of Linux shell scripts and Python scripts to automate data analysis, copy operations and application of AI algorithms.
Implementation and monitoring of long-term calculations on Linux-based computing clusters and workstations.
Support/training/assistance of scientific staff in the use of image and data analysis software: Imaris, ImageJ, Huygens Deconvolution, Genedata Screener, Columbus, CellProfiler
Deployment: Installation of the software, the software developed in our group on the computers of the end users (Mac and Windows)
Maintenance/administration of Windows image analysis PCs
Maintenance/administration of the servers of various web services (Huygens Deconvolution, Genedata Screener, Columbus…)
Internal billing of the services
Documentation
Requirements
University degree (B.A.) in a subject related to computer science or alternatively training in a profession related to computer science and several years of sound professional experience
Programming knowledge in Linux Shell and Python
A high degree of service orientation
Interest in learning how to use various software packages for image and data analysis and training other employees in the use of these programs (ImageJ, CellProfiler, Imaris etc.)
Experience in the administration of Linux and Windows systems
Good language skills in English (required) and German (preferred)
We offer
An interesting and challenging task in a research center that works on the future topics of health research
An international environment characterized by a strong focus on science and research
A high potential for the individual development of our employees
Targeted personnel development
A full-time position, initially temporary limited to 2 years
Employment, payment and social benefits are determined by the Public Sector Collective Agreement (Tarifvertrag für den öffentlichen Dienst – TVöD Bund).

Für unseren Partner KAMAX, einen weltweit führenden Hersteller von Verbindungselementen und Zulieferer für alle Unternehmen der Automobilindustrie, suchen wir einen Data Science Expert (m/w/d) für den Standort Düsseldorf. Im Zuge der Digitalisierung wird derzeit eine neue Unternehmensstrategie implementiert und genau hier kommen Sie ins Spiel!

Sie haben Lust, in einem internationalen Umfeld, den Aufbau der Digital Unit mitzubegleiten und die gesamte End-to-End-Value-Chain von der Datenbeschaffung bis hin zum Deployment der Datenmodelle zu begleiten? Dann sind Sie hier genau richtig.

Aufgaben
Sie sind verantwortlich für die Modellentwicklung in den Bereichen Predictive Maintenance, Preisoptimierung, Produktionsplanung und Bestandsoptimierung
Gewährleistung der Bereitstellung von hochqualitativen Daten
Kontinuierliche Verbesserung der Datenstruktur
Sie betreuen das Deployment und den Betrieb des Datenmodells
Führung von Projekten zusammen mit dem Projektmanager
Qualifikation
Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium (Statistik, Mathematik, Data Science oder vergleichbares)
Erfahrungen in der Betreuung der gesamten Daten-Pipeline mit den Tools Docker, Kubernetes, REST und SOAP
Praktische Kenntnisse mit den Programmiersprachen Python und R
Kenntnisse in der Datenbankintegration inklusive Apache, Kafka, Spark, Hadoop, MongoDB
Erfahrungen in der Industriebranche
Mut, neue Wege zu gehen und bestehende Strukturen zu hinterfragen
Benefits
Gestaltungsmöglichkeiten auf der grünen Wiese
Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten hin zu Führungspositionen
Flache Hierarchien
Ein internationales Umfeld
Ihre Ansprechpartnerin ist Kristin Zimmermann. Sie erreichen sie auch direkt im Office unter +49 (0) 40 180 241 182 oder mobil unter +49 (0) 151 688 276 44.

Job Title: Senior Data Scientist - Search and Discovery (f/m/d)
Job Description:
Want to be a hero? - Join the #1 Global Leader in online food ordering and delivery!

We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist (f/m/d) to join our Consumer team to create a smooth and easy ordering experience for our customers. If you’re a creative problem solver who is hungry for a new adventure, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!

Your mission:
Develop new data products from conception to operationalization to help optimizing our logistics processes and improving the experience for our customers.

Scale up your algorithm to provide business value in dozens of countries globally supporting a fleet of tens of thousands of couriers

Help defining data needs to further improve existing projects, to support data engineering and tech teams in planning their roadmap.

Work with structured and semi-structured data from different data sources (BigQuery, PostgreSQL, Spark and many more).

Contribute and make an impact in a global, fast-moving tech organization.

What do you bring to the table?

You have experience applying methods from machine learning and statistics to real-world datasets.

You can write maintainable code that follows best practices in software engineering.

You know how to make your code run in a container and are enthusiastic about running it in modern infrastructure environments like Kubernetes.

Fluency in Python and familiarity with its scientific stack such as numpy, pandas, scikit learn, matplotlib.

You know how to work with Big Data platforms such as Spark/Hadoop and know how to write a SQL query to pull the data you need.

Fluency in English.

Why Delivery Hero?

Develop your skills with your educational budget for conferences and external trainings.

Exchange ideas and meet fellow developers at regular meetups, in our active guilds and during our Global Developer Exchange Program.

Join company parties, hackathons, cultural and sports events.

Work in diverse teams with colleagues from across the globe in English.

Save responsibly with our corporate pension scheme.

Daily fruits, cereals, beverages, tea and coffee in our lounges.

Learn German with free classes, access our e-learning platform and participate in our inhouse trainings.

Enjoy massages, get your haircut in the office, join our free yoga classes or take a timeout in our nap room.

About us:
Delivery Hero Tech is playing an exceptional role in the large growth of our company. Our Tech teams leverage a diverse stack to create cutting-edge solutions which cover the full customer experience - starting with a great online search experience and ending with a real-time delivery at your doorstep.

Read about the latest updates from our Tech & Product teams on our blog.

Delivery Hero is building the next generation global on-demand delivery platform. We have grown rapidly from inception in 2011 to become the world's largest food-ordering network and we’re now innovating and creating new verticals such as groceries, pharmacies, flowers and other convenience articles in multiple markets.

Our awesome international team already operates in 40+ countries worldwide and we are looking for the most talented people to join us on our mission to ‘always deliver an amazing experience.’ If you’re an enthusiastic problem solver and hungry for a new adventure, an exciting job and multicultural workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!

At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and representation is key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, or any other aspect that makes you, you.

Have we caught your attention? If you are looking for an environment where our company DNA is defined by our values, please send us your CV.

Find out more information on how to prepare for you technical interview here.

We’re looking forward to your application!

Jetzt bewerben
Heiner Duchow
Human Resources
Deutsche Welle
Deutsche Welle
Kurt-Schumacher-Straße 3
53113 Bonn
Datenschutzerklärung | Impressum

Zum Ausbau unseres Teams Data Science an den Standort Stuttgartsuchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt einen Senior Data Scientist (m/w/d)

Als Teil der KI group hilft KI performance seinen Kunden dabei die Ressource Daten" zielorientiert und nachhaltig einzusetzen. In agilen Teams setzen wir Methoden und Technologien aus den Bereichen Data Analytics, Deep Learning, Process Mining und Business Intelligence ein, um aus den Daten der Kunden effizientere, schnellere und bessere Wertschöpfungsprozesse zu machen. Kein Projekt findet bei uns ohne Business Case Betrachtung statt, weshalb wir bei KI performance nicht nur reine IT-nerds sondern vor allem kommunikative Schnittstellen zwischen IT und Business suchen.

Als zertifizierter Microsoft Gold-Partner bearbeiten wir die faszinierende Microsoft-Cloud-Welt in ihrer gesamten Bandbreite. Du arbeitest stets mit den neuesten Produkten an innovativen und anspruchsvollen Projekten

Im Einzelnen bedeutet dies:
Anwendung statistischer und prädiktiver Modellierungskonzepte, Clustering, Klassifizierungs- und Regressionsverfahren sowie Empfehlungsalgorithmen zur Vorhersage und Optimierung.
Entwicklung in den Sprachen Python, R oder C# zur Automatisierung, Optimierung von Unternehmensprozessen mittels mathematisch-statistischen Modellen
Unterstützung und Beratung von Unternehmen bei der Implementierung und Nutzung von Big-Data und KI-Lösungen
Beratung von Unternehmen hinsichtlich neuer und effizienter Prozesse mit inkludierten Prognosemodellen
Durchführung von Workshops und Meetings mit technischem und nicht technischem Publikum
Projektorganisation
Dein Profil:


Abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Wirtschaftsinformatik, Informatik, Mathematik, Statistik, Soziologie, Psychologie oder einem vergleichbaren Studienfach mit erheblich analytischen Anteilen und Ausrichtungen
Erfahrungen im Bereich Big Data, Data Mining, Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Künstlicher Intelligenz
Erfahrung in den Sprachen R, Python oder C#
Erfahrungen mit Microsoft Analytics Komponenten und Microsoft Big-Data Komponenten in Azure (z.B. Azure ML, Databricks, Hadoop, Datalake oder ähnlichen)
Idealerweise bereits erste Erfahrungen in den Bereichen SQL, NoSQL oder Kafka
Freundliches, seriöses Auftreten mit einem kundenorientierten und empathischen Umgang
Interesse, sich weiterzuentwickeln zu Themen wie Machine Learning, Bots, Big Data, etc.
Einsatzbereitschaft, Verantwortungsbewusstsein und Selbstständigkeit
Gute Kommunikations- und Präsentationsfähigkeiten
Teamfähigkeit
Reisebereitschaft innerhalb Deutschlands
Sehr gute Deutschkenntnisse setzen wir für die Tätigkeiten voraus
Das erwartet Dich bei uns:


Du wirst in einem Team aus Business-, BI- und Dataexperten spannende Software und Analysesysteme entwickeln und führenden Branchen und Unternehmen in Deutschland und Europa helfen, sich hinsichtlich Effizienz und Alleinstellung moderner Technologien und Verfahren zu bedienen. Außerdem wirst Du bei uns viel über Technologie, Beratung und der passenden Kommunikation lernen.

Deine individuelle Entwicklung ist uns wichtig und wir möchten, dass wir Dir dabei helfen, diese voranzubringen, genauso wie Du uns mit deinem Wissen, Spirit und Einsatz hilfst. Bei uns findest Du nicht nur Standardlösungen sondern auch unkonventionelle Lösungsansätze sind für uns sehr wichtig.

Für den Bewerbungsprozess benötigen wir von Dir folgende Angaben:
Deinen Lebenslauf, gern detailliert mit relevanten Tätigkeiten
Angabe Deiner Gehaltsvorstellung und Verfügbarkeit
Nutze hierfür einfach den unten stehenden "Bewerben".Button.

Gerne beantworten Dir Gerard Deine Fragen.

Job Title: Lead Data Analyst - Zalando Lounge Logistics
Job Description:
As a Lead Data Analyst for our Logistics Business Intelligence Team at Zalando Offprice, you will help foster a more data driven strategy for our Zalando Offprice Logistics. While putting data at the core of our decisions and processes, you will support us in financial planning, descriptive and predictive analytics, and deep dive analyses as part of our mission to improve operational efficiency and the customer experience.

The position is a key vacancy in our organisation and will not only set the foundation for Logistics reporting, but also have visibility and interaction with senior management.

WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
You define our logistics data analytics roadmap and define models that enable us to better analyse and understand operational processes, patterns, and trends.
Excellent communicator and with your data storytelling skills support our senior management and business teams taking data-based business decisions and actions.
Translating questions into testable hypotheses and research questions to drive business to the next level. Your deep dive analyses and visualisations on large & diverse data sets will help us to develop our business model.
Mentorship for junior analysts and coach your commercial colleagues to grow their analytical capabilities. You will further spark the team's enthusiasm for being data-driven, and help them to be able to get and work on the data they need to base decisions on their own analyses.
WHAT WE ARE LOOKING FOR
You balance technical acumen with business understanding and excel in collaborating with commercial stakeholders to drive insightful, robust analyses. Proven track record of 6+ years as a quantitative analyst in an e-commerce environment with 3+ years of people leadership experience.
Advanced proficiency in SQL (experience with Spark/Databricks a plus), Tableau for data visualisation & storytelling, and Excel. Proficiency in data transformation and statistical computing in Python or R.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills with a curious and self-starter mindset. Excellent stakeholder management skills. You couple your passion for big data with pragmatism to drive actions and impact.
Excellent educational background in Economics, Business Informatics, Statistics or similar quantitative field. Advanced degree preferred.
PERKS AT WORK
Culture of trust, empowerment and constructive feedback resulting in a positive and inspiring work atmosphere
An active AC&C community for analysts to exchange, learn, mentor and test new ideas.
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices in Berlin, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available only in select locations)
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

ABOUT ZALANDO LOUNGE


Zalando Lounge is an online shopping club for fashion and lifestyle products in 14 European countries. We offer our members daily, time-limited sale campaigns with discounts of up to 75% off the recommended retail price. However, Zalando Lounge is so much more than discounts. Our strength lies in our focus on fashion: from sought-after labels to niche brands, from famous international names to trendy luxury brands, we make sure to meet the fashion taste of all our customers, who are always on the hunt for the best products at the best prices. Working with our brand partners, we're pioneering innovative supply-chain and production processes and offer them an impactful and smart solution, creating a new way to shop for fashion - and a new way to sell it.

Job Title: Senior Data Engineer - Zalando Marketing Services
Job Description:
As a Senior Data Engineer within the ZMS Data team, you will take end to end ownership of our Data Management Platform. You are responsible to ingest new Data Sources, often in collaboration with our Data Science team. You will increase processing speed and optimize costs of our EMR clusters.
You will choose emerging technologies and approaches to create high-performance data processing solutions that scale. You will challenge our status quo and help us define best practices for how we work by designing data-intensive applications. Our data teams aim to solve the specific problems of a very data-driven company that has already begun the journey to become a platform.

WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED
Designing, developing, and operating data integration pipelines to provide high-quality datasets for analytical and machine learning use-cases. You and your team will own your code, and decide on the technologies and tools to deliver as well as operate large-scale applications on a PaaS/SaaS cloud (AWS)
Involved in building new ETL processes that might include combining data from multiple sources and maintaining the existing ones.
Responsible for doing ad hoc analysis and building impactful data visualizations
Consulting with Analysts, Data Scientists, and Product Managers to build and continuously improve a variety of data products that create value for our business.
Heavily contribute to making integrated data and machine learning models available in real-time to our application landscape. Be a sparring partner to other team members, and provide support and guidance to other engineers to help develop their technical capabilities.
WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR
Excellent knowledge in working with Apache Spark, plus very good knowledge of relational database systems (e.g PostgreSQL), knowledge of additional Big Data technologies like Hive, Flink or Kafka is a plus.
Experience doing data analysis with SQL
Solid programming skills in Scala / Java and Python
Knowledge of workflow management tools such as Airflow and hands-on experience in cloud technologies (AWS ideally), container/orchestration tools (Kubernetes, Docker).
PERKS AT WORK
A workplace run on trust, empowerment and feedback; positive, inspiring working atmosphere
Competitive salary, employee share shop, 40% Zalando shopping discount, discounts from external partners, centrally located offices, public transport discounts, municipality services, great IT equipment, flexible working times, additional holidays and volunteering time off, free beverages and fruits, diverse sports and health offerings
Mentoring and personal development opportunities and an international team of experts
Relocation assistance for internationals, PME family service and parent & child rooms* (*available in select locations)
We celebrate diversity and are committed to building teams that represent a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

ABOUT ZALANDO MARKETING SERVICES


Zalando Marketing Services (ZMS) is the 360° marketing unit of Europe 's leading online platform for fashion and lifestyle, Zalando. We work with the world's largest fashion and lifestyle brands and provide them with impactful solutions across all marketing touchpoints, access to relevant audiences and in-depth data knowledge, as well as inspiring creation and content.

At ZMS we create meaningful connections between brands and consumers through a deep understanding of their personalities. We work with brands, agencies and publishers from fashion and beyond to produce innovative, impactful campaigns that reach the right audience at the right moment. Thanks to its holistic mix of cutting-edge and privacy compliant technology, in-depth audience insights, expansive reach and compelling content brands produce successful campaigns across multiple digital marketing channels.

For more information check out this link:https://zms.zalando.com/

Fähigkeit, Initiativen über mehrere Produktbereiche hinweg zu leiten und die Ergebnisse teamübergreifend zu kommunizieren.

Unternehmen befinden sich weltweit in einem digitalen Wandel. Big Data, Internet of Things und Industrie 4.0 lauten die Schlüsselwörter der Digitalisierung. xValue positioniert sich als Treiber dieser Transformation und bietet als branchenübergreifende Value-Beratung kundenspezifische Leistungen in den digitalgetriebenen Themenfeldern IoT, Big Data & Analytics und Augmented Reality.

DEINE AUFGABEN

Durch strategische Auswertungsverfahren strukturierter Daten (Zahlen und Tabellen) bzw. strukturierten Datenformaten (Texten, Videos oder Website-Informationen) ermittelst du Trend- entwicklungen und Regelmäßigkeit zur Entwicklung von Algorithmen, Vorhersagemodellen oder Maschine-Leraning-Verfahren. Dein Können im Umgang mit Zeitreihenanalysen, Clusterverfahren oder Regressionsmodellen wird anspruchsvoll abgerufen, um die digitale Transformation zur Wirtschaft 4.0 voranzutreiben.

DEIN PROFIL
abgeschlossenes Studium der Statistik, Informatik, Mathematik oder vergleichbaren Studiengängen

wünschenswert aber nicht zwingend notwendig sind erste Kenntnisse in Big Data Technologien/Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Oozie)
fließende Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift, sowie Reisebereitschaft

Wir freuen uns auf Deine Bewerbung!

As a leading mobile games developer, Jam City is looking to “level up” our talent. We’re on the hunt for innovators who consider themselves dynamic, collaborative, and thrive in a fast-paced environment.

Are you interested in using data to help drive product decisions and directly influence the experience of millions of people playing our games?

We are looking for passionate & proactive Data Analyst to join our team in Berlin! You will have the opportunity to collaborate with some of the gaming industry's top professionals, touching on large amounts of data, and helping our teams make quick & impactful changes to our games.

The game data analyst works with product managers inside the studio team to analyze player behavior and overall performance in our games. You will collaborate with data scientists and analysts across the company to support live operations that continuously improve engagement and monetization. We are looking for a creative analytical mind that combines quantitative rigor with and deep understanding of what makes mobile games great.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Responsible for transforming raw data into digestible reports and actionable insights
Work closely with product management team to monitor product health, prioritize features, measure event performance, and optimize merchandising
Setup and maintain live dashboards (i.e. Tableau) and write SQL queries to support rapid decision making
Validate data sets and BI calls in live games to ensure accuracy of event logging and reporting
Conduct deeper inquiries into player behavior by coordinating with central data science team
Provide ad hoc analysis and insights to help interpret player reception of new features or events
Help design controlled experiments to test hypotheses about new features
Present reports on KPIs, event engagement, game economy, and more
Build models to run sensitivities and forecast outcomes
Develop reporting strategies for games in development to ensure event schema and data architecture are set up for efficient, comprehensive analysis
Think creatively about how to use data to answer question or confirm/reject hypotheses
QUALIFICATIONS
B.A. or B.S. a quantitative field (Math/Statistics, CS, Engineering, Business, Economics, experimental science, or similar), graduate degree a plus
3+ years experience in an analyst role at a mobile gaming company, or similar experience
Ability to think strategically (big picture perspective, consider both the player experience and the business needs) combined with hands-on, execution-oriented attitude
Experience in analytics requirements gathering, solution design and implementation; solid experience in the area of user intelligence / behavior, event tagging / tracking
Knowledge of statistics and statistical models, such as linear / logistic regression, clustering and factor analyses
Expert knowledge of SQL, Excel, and data visualization tools like Tableau
Detail-oriented, leaves no stone unturned, never lets anything slip through the cracks
Communication skills to articulate complex quantitative analyses in a way that a broad game team can understand
Any experience using Python, R, Scala, BigQuery, Databricks, Bayesian Statistics, Machine Learning a plus.
Self-motivated with the ability to work independently
Work closely with a cross-functional team, including remote team members and collegues in North and South America.
ABOUT JAM CITY
Jam City is an award-winning mobile entertainment studio providing unique and deeply engaging games that appeal to a broad, global audience.

Led by CEO Chris DeWolfe, former MySpace co-founder and CEO, and COO Josh Yguado, former 20th Century Fox executive, Jam City is the creative powerhouse behind some of the highest-grossing and most enduring mobile games. Jam City’s global franchise Cookie Jam has generated more than half a billion dollars, and Panda Pop has more than 120 million downloads to date.

The company also is the go-to studio for Hollywood, having developed immersive, narrative-rich mobile games around iconic entertainment brands. The company’s popular RPG game Harry Potter: Hogwarts Mystery was the #1 game in more than 40 countries at its launch in April 2018.

Jam City has nine studios located in Los Angeles (HQ), Berlin, Buenos Aires, Bogotá, Burbank, Cedar Falls, San Diego, San Francisco, and Toronto.

Job Title: Data Scientist / Statistician for Chemometrics (m/f/d) - Datenbankentwicklung / BI, IT
Job Description:
Responsibilities


Our IR Sensing unit develops, produces and distributes NIR spectrometer solutions under the name trinamiX NIR Spectroscopy Solutions. Together with our customers we develop solutions for different applications like agriculture, food analysis and spectroscopy up to spark detection and fire detection.
You will take care of scientific data analysis, evaluation of statistical hypotheses and data-based modelling.
Furthermore, you will be responsible for optimization, design of experiments and Six Sigma methodology as well as visualization.
Moreover, you will develop robust systems for the chemometric evaluation of substance data from spectroscopic measurements.
You will be part of an multidisciplinary research team.
With the appropriate experts, you will integrate the models into a larger software stack.
Qualifications
University degree in applied mathematics, statistics, chemometrics, computer science or related fields, preferably with a PhD or comparable professional experience
As a career changer: scientific or engineering background
Ideally, professional experience in data analysis, data modelling, targeted data search and statistical analysis Additional knowledge in machine learning and nonlinear optimization is an advantage
Profound experience with R, SAS, Python or other programming languages in fast prototyping
Motivated and creative team player with excellent communication as well as presentation skills in German and English
Enjoyment working in an interdisciplinary research and development team
Benefits
An attractive competitive salary that is based on the company's success and your individual performance.
Flexible work arrangements so that you can balance your working life and private life.
About us


Do you have questions about the application process or the vacancy? Mr Fidan Bllacaku (Talent Acquisition), Tel.: +49 (0)30 2005 59400
trinamiX GmbH was established in 2015 with its headquarters in Ludwigshafen and is a wholly owned subsidiary of BASF SE. As a start-up, we are operationally independent and can, at the same time, rely on the competence and experience of the BASF Group. What drives us? Our technologies are designed to make it possible for humans and machines to capture and understand the world - for better decision-making and more security. That is our goal in the areas of 3D sensor technology, distance measurement and infrared sensor technology. We are not looking for successors or replacements for our team. We are looking for pioneers!
Learn more about trinamiX GmbH at www.trinamiX.de

At BASF, the chemistry is right. Because we are counting on innovative solutions, on sustainable actions, and on connected thinking. And on you. Become a part of our formula for success and develop the future with us - in a global team that embraces diversity and equal opportunities irrespective of gender, age, origin, sexual orientation, disability or belief.

LOCATION: Ludwigshafen, DE, 67056
COMPANY: trinamiX GmbH
JOB FIELD: IT / Information Management
JOB CONDITIONS: Permanent
JOB ID: EN58522467_ONLE_3

Job Title: Data Scientist & Developer*in [m/w/d] | Expert*in für mutiges Data Science und Software-Entwicklung
Job Description:
WAYS ist eine junge Innovation Factory aus Dortmund. Bei uns arbeitest du in einem interdisziplinären Team, bestehend aus individuellen Kreativen, Techies und Berater*innen, die sich am liebsten in einer kreativen und schnellen Umgebung entfalten. Unser Penthouse Office eröffnet dir den besten Blick auf den Phoenix See. Wir bieten dir alles was du brauchst, um dich kreativ auszuleben, flexible Arbeitszeiten, Family Spirit und einen modernen Arbeitsplatz. Bei uns steht deine Entwicklung im Fokus. Dafur geben wir dir den notigen Raum fur deine Ideen und deine Lieblings-Arbeitsweise.

Wir denken groß und haben Lust auf Zukunft: Als Unternehmen der Unternehmerkraft® Group begleiten wir mit unseren Schwestern brandneo und Fritz-Effekt international agierende Unternehmen gesamtheitlich in ihrer digitalen Transformation.

Aufgaben


Du bist Freidenker*in und Multitalent im digitalen Zeitalter und motiviert, die datenanalytische Perspektive des digitalen Wandels einzunehmen. Dich faszinieren digitale Trends, innovative Technologien und die neuen Möglichkeiten für Unternehmen und Produkte. Du willst nicht die nächste BI-Software entwickeln, die genau so arbeitet wie alle bisherigen Ansätze. Du schaffst Innovation: Neue Probleme benötigen neue Ansätze. Dir geht es weniger um oberflächliches Data Science, sondern mehr darum, die Komplexität zu verstehen und maßgeschneidert zu übersetzen.

Du glaubst daran, dass die konsequente Vereinigung von Computational und Data Science gemeinsam mit den Naturwissenschaften im WAYS Data Lab zu neuen Verfahren sowohl in der Optimierung als auch in der Produktion führen kann.

Erst suchen wir Menschen, dann Skills: Uns ist der Charakter hinter der Bewerbungsmappe wichtig. Bei uns arbeiten Teamplayer*innen, die sich am liebsten in einer kreativen und schnellen Umgebung entfalten. Du bist Data Scientist bei WAYS.

Qualifikation
Du hast dein Studium in den Bereichen Informatik, Datenwissenschaften, Statistik o. ä. bereits abgeschlossen.
Du hast Programmiersprachen wie z. B. Python und / oder C++ bereits ausführlich angewendet.
Du kennst neue Technologien und Trends vor dem Release und beziehst sie in deine Arbeit mit ein.
Neben Deutsch sprichst und schreibst du fließend Englisch.
Du kennst unterschiedliche Data Mining-Verfahren und verfügst über Kenntnisse mathematisch-statistischer Methoden.
Deine Fokusthemen sind die Bewertung von technischen Umsetzungen, Software-Entwicklung, Datenaufbereitung und -analyse sowie Visualisierung von Daten.
Optionaler Pluspunkt: Du bringst bereits 1-2 Jahre Berufserfahrung in einem der oben genannten Themen mit mit und besitzt spezielles Fachwissen (IoT, Textanalyse, etc.).
Du wechselst deine Aufgaben bewusst und regelmäßig: Wir nennen das strukturierte Wildheit.
Benefits


STRIVING FOR KNOWLEDGE, NOT FOR DATA

Du konzipierst im WAYS Data Lab mit eigenen Verfahren, Modellen und Algorithmen zukunftsfähige Lösungen und setzt diese direkt für unsere Kunden um. Die essentielle Basis sind dabei für dich agiles und effizientes Opportunity Thinking und eigene Forschung.

STATE OF THE ART

Du setzt auf relevante Tools und Bibliotheken wie z. B. NumPy, SciPy und Pandas. Du visualisierst vom Jupyter Notebook bis zum Dashboard mit Plotly/D3 und kennst den Workflow vom Dashboard-Frontend (Jquery, ReactJS) über Flask bis zum Backend (Airflow, MongoDB, Elastic Stack, Kubernetes, Docker, Spark).

DIVERSITY & SKILLS

Darüber hinaus ist der aktive Austausch mit unseren Teams aus Business Development, Creative Conception, IT und Marketing ein Must-have. In Projekten und Konzepten mit unterschiedlichen Skills zusammenzuarbeiten ist für dich eine Bereicherung. Mit deinem cleveren Projektmanagement und Tools wie Asana, Slack oder der G-Suite hast du deine Projekte immer im Blick.

TIME TO SHINE

Jeder bei WAYS hat die Möglichkeit erzielte Meilensteine im Team und vor unseren Kundinnen zu präsentieren. Dabei nimmst du regelmäßig die Perspektive unserer Kunden ein und denkst sowohl wirtschaftlich als auch nachhaltig. Du hast Lust, die digitale Zukunft zu gestalten und bist motiviert als Intrapreneurin zu wirken und deine eigenen Ideen voranzutreiben.

Uns ist der Mensch hinter der Bewerbungsmappe wichtig und den wollen wir von Anfang an sehen.

Zeig uns, was dich ausmacht und warum du die/der nächste Data Scientist bei WAYS bist.
